resources.string: Welcome to Heterocera, an app for identifying and recording moths around Ireland.
This is all of Heterocera\'s current functionality. Thank you for using Heterocera.
Heterocera displays your recorded observations on a map of Ireland. You can select an observation and view when it was taken, where, and what moth species was captured.

The encyclopedia function provides you with detailed information about different species of moths. To access this feature, simply click on the encyclopedia icon on the home screen. Here, you can browse through a wealth of information about each species, including their habitat, behaviors, and physical characteristics.
You can view your recorded observations here. They are displayed in a list, and can be viewed in detail by selecting a given observation by tapping on it.

After the analysis, the app will transition to an observation capture screen, where you can edit your observation further. This screen is where you can provide more information about the moth you captured. You can add details about the observation. Try and focus on capturing where you observed the moth, and what time of day it was. This function allows you to record your observations, which can later be used to create a comprehensive record of your observations.

The camera is the core of Heterocera. Press the camera icon to take an image. You can pinch the camera screen to zoom in and out, to adjust the view. The image will be saved to your device\'s memory, and will then analysed by Heterocera\'s moth identification model. Please give the model a few seconds to run its analysis.
This help manual can be accessed anytime by pressing the question-mark icon present in the top-right portion of the main screen
